resources.string: Type of censor ratings to be displayed (NC-17 / 18\'s etc)
Movie Manager! This app is currently under active development, and I hope to add regular updates. If you have a suggestion please contact me or leave a comment!
Welcome to the beta version of Movie Manager. Let me know if you find any bugs! Whats new in this version: Films plots, Special effects, pitch film changed, how to play instructions

The goal of the game is to become Hollywood\'s biggest film producer and to get to the top of the all time box office. You start by creating your production company, and choosing which script you would like to make into a film. You can also create your own script if you have your own idea. You send the script out to producers to get some investment, and then hire a director, actors, and get your special effects.

All development by Simon Wielens. Icons/images/random genius by Andy Wielens. Inspired by Sim-Cinema Deluxe by Shannon Schroeder. Thanks to: Menu icons from @AndroidIcons. Paul, Dave, Gary, Conor, Brian, and Patrick Greig for feedback. Niamh for putting up with me while I work on this app :-)
You can either choose one of the 3 scripts below, or develop your own idea
Enter the name of your film:
Choose a Director to approach: (only showing directors you can afford)
Choose a lead actor to approach: (only showing actors you can afford)
The movie earned a grand total of: %s
The movie earned a net profit of: %s
Choose the name of your production company:
We think your script is great. Best we can do is 20 bucks
We aren\'t too sure, but we are willing to take a chance, here\'s $%dM
We think the script has potential, here\'s $%dM
We really like the script, we can give you $%dM
We love it, now shut up and take our money.

Choose the type of content for your film. The stronger the content, the stricter the rating your film will get, which will reduce your potential audience. However, choose the content levels which would be appropriate for your movie\'s genre (e.g. a Kid\'s film with strong sex and violence would be a flop (as well as being a bit disturbing!) but a Horror film which is rated \'G\' will probably not be interesting enough to get movie-goers excited)
Choose the level of special effects/CGI in your movie
Swipe left and right to view offers
After the distributor takes their cut for funding the project, you are left with $%d profit
